chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Earl P. Cross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing Hearing on Revocation from September 7, 2017

Defendant Earl P. Cross in court with attorney T. Gregory Amann.  Defendant Earl P. Cross in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both attorneys admit receipt of PSI, no corrections or objections.
Atty Poquette makes statement.  Atty Amann makes statement.  Court asks questions of Atty Aaman.  Atty Aaman continues.  DE makes statement.
Court sentences:  5 years prison-  2 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision.  Conditions of extended supervision- No Contact with Mathew Carroll.   Mental Health assessment and treatment, any other counseling deemed appropriate by DOC.  AODA assessment and follow-through with recommendations.  Pay outstanding court obligations as previously ordered plus any supervision fees.
DE has credit for 333 days served.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 7, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Earl P. Cross in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Defendant Earl P. Cross in custody.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint.  Attorney Duffy wants to address bond and get a signature bond.  State feels $5,000 appropriate, but could be a joint cash bond on both matters though.  Court doesn't feel substantial ties to community, court modifies bond to a joint cash bond of $4,000.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 09:30 am.
DEF Earl P Cross appears in court in custody.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 12th at 8:30 am.
